events.description: Staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates held in the Special Housing Unit (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) throughout the entire day.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison logs showing 30-minute observation checks for inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on July 5, 2019.
The logs follow a strict protocol requiring inmates in locked-down status to be observed at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule no more than 40 minutes apart.
The sheets are reviewed and signed by shift lieutenants (Morning, Day, Evening Watch) and a Captain.
The document is part of the standard operating procedure for monitoring high-risk or segregated inmates in federal custody.
